SEARCH
Package pdf.concat.menu

Class AbstractMenu

java.lang.Object
pdf.concat.menu.AbstractMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interactable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MergeMenu, MultiConcatMenu, MultiReverseMenu
public abstract class AbstractMenu extends Object implements Interactable
Abstract class that contains methods that are used in all menu classes. It contains methods that are used to add buttons to the frame, set their visibility, change field colors, check if the type is correct, move buttons, create input, set warnings visible and set important bounds.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface pdf.concat.menu.Interactable

  • Method Details

    • addToFrame

      public void addToFrame(JButton function, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JButton back, JLabel wrong, JTextField field, JLabel title, JLabel wrongWarning)
      Adds text to the frame.
      Parameters:
      function - JButton that is used to perform the function.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      back - JButton that is used to go back to the main menu.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      title - JLabel that is used to display the title of the function.
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.

    • setVisibility

      public void setVisibility(boolean input, Chooser inputChooser, Chooser outputChooser, JButton rev, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JButton back, JLabel wrong, JButton add, JTextField field, JLabel title, JLabel wrongWarning, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Changes the visibility of the components for MultiReverse Menu. If input is true, it sets the visibility of the input components to true and the rest to false. If input is false, it sets the visibility of the input components to false and the rest to false.
      Parameters:
      input - boolean that determines if the input components should be visible.
      inputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      outputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the output file.
      rev - JButton that is used to reverse the order of the input files.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      back - JButton that is used to go back to the main menu.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.
      add - JButton that is used to add more input files.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      title - JLabel that is used to display the title of the function.
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.

    • setVisibility

      public void setVisibility(boolean input, Chooser inputChooser1, Chooser inputChooser2, Chooser folderChooser, JButton con, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JButton back, JLabel wrong, JButton add, JTextField field, JLabel title, JLabel wrongWarning, List<Chooser> inputList)

      inputChooser1 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      inputChooser2 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      folderChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the folder where the output file will be saved.
      con - JButton that is used to concatenate the input files.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      back - JButton that is used to go back to the main menu.

    • changeFieldColors

      public void changeFieldColors(boolean input, Chooser inputChooser, Chooser outputChooser, JTextField field, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Changes the field colors based on the input boolean. If input is true, it changes the colors of the inputChooser and outputChooser to red and the field to red. If input is false, it changes the colors of the inputList, inputChooser and outputChooser to white and the field to white.
      Parameters:
      input - boolean that determines if the colors should be changed to red.
      inputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      outputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the output file.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.

    • changeFieldColors

      public void changeFieldColors(boolean input, Chooser inputChooser1, Chooser inputChooser2, Chooser folderChooser, JTextField field, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Changes the field colors based on the input boolean. If input is true, it changes the colors of the inputChooser1, inputChooser2 and folderChooser to red and the field to red. If input is false, it changes the colors of the inputList, inputChooser1, inputChooser2 and folderChooser to white and the field to white.
      Parameters:
      input - boolean that determines if the colors should be changed to red.
      inputChooser1 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      inputChooser2 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      folderChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the folder where the output file will be saved.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.

    • changeFieldColors

      public void changeFieldColors(boolean input, Chooser inputChooser1, Chooser inputChooser2, Chooser folderChooser, JTextField field)
      Changes the field colors based on the input boolean. If input is true, it changes the colors of the inputChooser1, inputChooser2 and folderChooser to red and the field to red. If input is false, it changes the colors of the inputChooser1, inputChooser2 and folderChooser to white and the field to white.
      Parameters:
      input - boolean that determines if the colors should be changed to red.
      inputChooser1 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      inputChooser2 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      folderChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the folder where the output file will be saved.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.

    • checkType

      public boolean checkType(Chooser inputChooser1, Chooser inputChooser2)
      Check if fields are filled. If they are not, change their colors to red and return true. If they are filled, return false. Used for MultiReverse Menu.
      Parameters:
      inputChooser1 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      inputChooser2 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      Returns:
      boolean that determines if the fields are filled.

    • checkType

      public boolean checkType(Chooser inputChooser, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Check if fields are filled. If they are not, change their colors to red and return true. If they are filled, return false. Used for MultiConcat Menu.
      Parameters:
      inputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.
      Returns:
      boolean that determines if the fields are filled.

    • checkType

      public boolean checkType(Chooser inputChooser1, Chooser inputChooser2, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Check if fields are filled. If they are not, change their colors to red and return true. If they are filled, return false. Used for MultiMerge Menu.
      Parameters:

      inputChooser2 - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.

    • moveButtons

      public void moveButtons(int count, Chooser outputChooser, JButton function, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JButton back, JLabel wrong, JButton add, JTextField field, JLabel wrongWarning, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Moves the buttons and fields based on the count of the inputList. If the inputList size is greater than the count, it sets the add button to invisible. If the inputList size is less than the count, it moves the buttons and fields down. Used for MultiConcat Menu.
      Parameters:
      count - int that determines the number of input files that can be added.
      outputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the output file.
      function - JButton that is used to perform the function.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      back - JButton that is used to go back to the main menu.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.
      add - JButton that is used to add more input files.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.

    • createInput

      public void createInput(boolean type, Chooser inputChooser, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JLabel wrong, JLabel wrongWarning, List<Chooser> inputList)
      Create PDF Chooser based on the type boolean. If type is true, it creates the first inputChooser. If type is false, it creates the inputChooser after the last inputChooser in the inputList.
      Parameters:
      type - boolean that determines if the inputChooser is the first one.
      inputChooser - Chooser that is used to choose the input file.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
      inputList - List of Choosers that are used to choose the input files.

    • wrongWarningSetVisible

      public void wrongWarningSetVisible(JLabel wrongWarning, JLabel finish, JLabel warning, JLabel wrong)
      Set the visibility of the warnings based on the input boolean. If input is true, it sets the wrongWarning to visible and the rest to invisible. If input is false, it sets the wrongWarning to invisible.
      Parameters:
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.

    • finishSetVisible

      public void finishSetVisible(JLabel wrongWarning, JLabel finish, JLabel warning, JLabel wrong)
      Set the visibility of the finish message based on the input boolean. If input is true, it sets the finish to visible and the rest to invisible. If input is false, it sets the finish to invisible.
      Parameters:
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.

    • warningSetVisible

      public void warningSetVisible(JLabel wrongWarning, JLabel finish, JLabel warning, JLabel wrong)
      Set the visibility of the warning message based on the input boolean. If input is true, it sets the warning to visible and the rest to invisible. If input is false, it sets the warning to invisible.
      Parameters:

      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.

    • setImportantBounds

      public void setImportantBounds(boolean input, JButton function, JLabel warning, JLabel finish, JButton back, JLabel wrong, JTextField field, JLabel wrongWarning)
      Set the bounds of the components based on the input boolean. If input is true, it sets the bounds of the components to the important bounds. If input is false, it sets the bounds of the components to the normal bounds.
      Parameters:
      input - boolean that determines if the bounds should be set to the important bounds.
      function - JButton that is used to perform the function.
      warning - JLabel that is used to display warning.
      finish - JLabel that is used to display finish message.
      back - JButton that is used to go back to the main menu.
      wrong - JLabel that is used to display wrong message.
      field - JTextField that is used to get the name of the file.
      wrongWarning - JLabel that is used to display wrong warning.
